visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing monthly revenue growth with synthetic data using trend and seasonality patterns. Include dynamic subtitle annotations and export-specific styling.
visualization_explanation:
The dataset contains 12 monthly observations (categorical x-axis) with synthetic revenue values (continuous y-axis). Data follows a μ=253k, σ=62k distribution with intentional patterns: 1) Upward trend (150k Jan → 350k Dec), 2) Mid-year dip (July-August seasonal effect). Synthetic values were generated using linear growth (20k/month base) + sinusoidal seasonality (±30k amplitude).

The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio (Tufte) by removing gridlines while using gradient fills for depth perception (Cairo's texture principle). Position/length encoding leverages human visual acuity for quantitative comparisons. Export settings demonstrate responsive design principles: sourceWidth/sourceHeight control base SVG dimensions before 2× scaling, removing annotations for print-ready output. YTD annotation (+133%) uses D3-style percentage formatting from point-initial comparison.
